Jotunn was calm, but deep in his circuits, long calculations were
being pro=
cessed.

His office was dark, only the holo projector giving off a blueish =
light.

He had cupped his chin in his hands and was thoughtful.

In front o=
f him, the holo projector displayed a table. It showed the
number of minion=
 attacks worlwide for the last megaclick.

There was a drop in them.

Now w=
as the time. And yet, what if he were wrong? He would not lose it
all at th=
e same time.

All he had to do was send one signal. One small signal.

One =
button.

Would he gamble everything? Would he risk it all?

His finger drop=
ped a little hesitantly on the key. There was no
turning back.

Iron Skulls=
 worldwide were sent a signal. It was a highly secret one
on an undisclosed=
 frequency. They were required to open their comm
channel to Ro66G.

Jotunn=
 sighed in anticipation. He wondered if Megatron would have felt
the way he=
 did.

That was all the reflections he afforded. He waited for the replies.=
